sect1.title: Adding the user lfs
sect1.para: When logged in as root, making a single mistake can damage or even wreck your system. Therefore we recommend that you build the packages in this chapter as an unprivileged user. You could of course use your own user name, but to make it easier to set up a clean work environment we'll create a new user lfs and use this one during the installation process. As root, issue the following command to add the new user:

listitem.para: -s /bin/bash: This makes bash the default shell for user lfs.
-m -k /dev/null: These create a home directory for lfs, while preventing the files from a possible /etc/skel being copied into it.
